New Records: Shadab Khan was named Player of the Match for his all-round performance.
Pakistan set a target of 186 runs for South Africa, which was revised due to rain to 142 runs and then further to 73 runs after the match resumed.
Key Match Events: Rain interrupted the match, causing a reduction in overs and changing the target.
South Africa's batting order collapsed after the match resumed, leading to a 33-run victory for Pakistan.
Mohammad Haris scored 28 off just 11 balls, including two sixes and a four.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and decided to bat first, setting a target of 186 runs.
South Africa made two changes to their playing XI, with Heinrich Klaasen replacing David Miller and Tabraiz Shamsi replacing Keshav Maharaj.
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam, Pakistan's captain, expressed joy over the victory and highlighted the team's resilience.
Shadab Khan praised the pitch, noting it was slower than in Perth but had spin.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was broadcast live on Star Sports and Disney+ Hotstar.
The Sydney Cricket Ground was described as a batting paradise with an average temperature of 18Â°C and 39% humidity.
